item.title: Create your own herb garden
item.description:
Wednesday, June 12, 2013, 5:30 – 7:30pm

Herbs are some of the easiest and most productive plants you can grow. Great for beginner gardeners or those with limited space, this small group workshop gives you the opportunity to create your own mixed potted herb garden to take home and enjoy. Presented by ABC Radio gardening presenter, Annette McFarlane. Bookings essential.

Venue: Coopers Plains Library
Venue address: 107 Orange Grove Rd, Coopers Plains 4108
Bookings: Required. Please phone (07) 3403 8888 to reserve your place.
Cost: Free
item.xCal:description: Herbs are some of the easiest and most productive plants you can grow. Great for beginner gardeners or those with limited space, this small group workshop gives you the opportunity to create your own mixed potted herb garden to take home and enjoy. Presented by ABC Radio gardening presenter, Annette McFarlane. Bookings essential.
item.x-trumba:customfield: Required. Please phone (07) 3403 8888 to reserve your place.

item.title: New Farm garden group
item.description:
Friday, June 14, 2013, 3 – 5pm

Come along to our meeting and exchange gardening hints, tips and ideas with other garden enthusiasts. Meet in the Garden Room at the back of the library. Feel free to bring seeds, seedlings or other produce from your garden to share.

Venue: New Farm Library
Venue address: 135 Sydney St, New Farm 4005
Bookings: Not required.
Cost: Free
item.xCal:description: Come along to our meeting and exchange gardening hints, tips and ideas with other garden enthusiasts. Meet in the Garden Room at the back of the library. Feel free to bring seeds, seedlings or other produce from your garden to share.

item.title: Breakfast with Alison Alexander
item.description:
Saturday, June 15, 2013, 6:30 – 9:30am

Enjoy breakfast with Alison Alexander as part of celebrations for the official opening of the new look Mitchelton Library.

Alison will prepare carrot, fetta and lemon pancakes for breakfast at Mitchelton Library. Have a tea or coffee with some of Alison's amazing savoury pancakes. 

Venue: Mitchelton Library
Venue address: 37 Heliopolis Pde, Mitchelton 4053
Bookings: Not required.
Cost: Free
item.xCal:description:
Enjoy breakfast with Alison Alexander as part of celebrations for the official opening of the new look Mitchelton Library.
Alison will prepare carrot, fetta and lemon pancakes for breakfast at Mitchelton Library. Have a tea or coffee with some of Alison's amazing savoury pancakes.

item.title: Gardening workshops for children
item.description:
Saturday, June 15, 2013, 8:30am – 12pm

Celebrate the official opening of the new look Mitchelton Library with children's gardening activities at the library.

Join local community group, Mitchelton Organic Gardeners to learn how to correctly pot a seedling and ways you can help your plant to grow.

Children can join the fun at any stage throughout the morning.

Venue: Mitchelton Library
Venue address: 37 Heliopolis Pde, Mitchelton 4053
Bookings: Not required.
Cost: Free
item.xCal:description:
Celebrate the official opening of the new look Mitchelton Library with children's gardening activities at the library.
Join local community group, Mitchelton Organic Gardeners to learn how to correctly pot a seedling and ways you can help your plant to grow.
Children can join the fun at any stage throughout the morning.

item.title: Live performance by The Reclaimers
item.description:
Saturday, June 15, 2013, 9 – 9:20am

Enjoy a live performance by The Reclaimers as part of celebrations for the official opening of the new look Mitchelton Library.

The Reclaimers street orchestra showcases unique hand-made instruments made from 'reclaimed' materials. The street orchestra mostly performs folk music, featuring string instruments, guitars and percussion.

Venue: Mitchelton Library
Venue address: 37 Heliopolis Pde, Mitchelton 4053
Bookings: Not required.
Cost: Free
item.xCal:description: Enjoy a live performance by The Reclaimers as part of celebrations for the official opening of the new look Mitchelton Library. The Reclaimers street orchestra showcases unique hand-made instruments made from 'reclaimed' materials. The street orchestra mostly performs folk music, featuring string instruments, guitars and percussion.

item.title: No-dig gardening and seasonal planting
item.description:
Saturday, June 15, 2013, 9:30 – 11:30am

Learn how to design, build and manage a seasonal, no-dig garden bed.

Cost: Free
Bookings: To book phone Claire on 0403 935 014.
Venue: Brisbane Botanic Gardens, Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Mount Coot-tha Road, Mount Coot-tha
item.xCal:description: Learn how to design, build and manage a seasonal, no-dig garden bed.

item.title: Live performance by The Reclaimers
item.description:
Saturday, June 15, 2013, 9:50 – 10:10am

Enjoy a live performance by The Reclaimers as part of celebrations for the official opening of the new look Mitchelton Library.

The Reclaimers street orchestra showcases unique hand-made instruments made from 'reclaimed' materials. The street orchestra mostly performs folk music, featuring string instruments, guitars and percussion.

Venue: Mitchelton Library
Venue address: 37 Heliopolis Pde, Mitchelton 4053
Bookings: Not required.
Cost: Free

item.title: Alison Alexander cooking with citrus
item.description:
Saturday, June 15, 2013, 10 – 11am

Celebrate the official opening of the new look Mitchelton Library with Alison Alexander.

Citrus fruits are versatile in the kitchen and can be used in savoury and sweet dishes. Taste some great recipes as food consultant Alison Alexander talks about how to use these readily available winter fruits in the kitchen.


Participants will receive a collection of delicious recipes to try at home.  

Venue: Mitchelton Library
Venue address: 37 Heliopolis Pde, Mitchelton 4053
Bookings: Not required.
Cost: Free.

item.title: Best native plants that improve garden wildlife
item.description:
Saturday, June 15, 2013, 10am – 12pm

Bookings essential.

Venue: Mt Ommaney Library
Venue address: Mt Ommaney Shopping Centre, 171 Dandenong Rd, Mt Ommaney 4074
Bookings: Required. Please phone (07) 3403 8888 to reserve your place.
Cost: Free

item.title: Citrus in the suburbs with Annette McFarlane
item.description:
Saturday, June 15, 2013, 10 – 10:30am

Celebrate the official opening of the new look Mitchelton Library with Annette McFarlane.

Fancy the idea of picking your own lemons and limes fresh from the tree? ABC Radio gardening presenter, Annette McFarlane will reveal all you need to know about growing your own citrus fruits during a stroll through the community citrus garden at Mitchelton Library.

Venue: Mitchelton Library
Venue address: 37 Heliopolis Pde, Mitchelton 4053
Bookings: Not required.
Cost: Free.
item.xCal:summary: Citrus in the suburbs with Annette McFarlane

Celebrate the official opening of the new look Mitchelton Library with Annette McFarlane.
Fancy the idea of picking your own lemons and limes fresh from the tree? ABC Radio gardening presenter, Annette McFarlane will reveal all you need to know about growing your own citrus fruits during a stroll through the community citrus garden at Mitchelton Library.

item.title: No-dig gardening
item.description:
Saturday, June 15, 2013, 10am – 12pm

This workshop is a practical demonstration of how to create a no-dig garden. No-dig gardening is renowned for being low-labour and low-cost, and an extremely simple way to create a healthy, functioning garden bed in no time. Learn step by step how to build the garden, as well as the science behind its success. Presented by Growing Communities. Light refreshments will be served. Bookings essential.

Venue: Everton Park Library
Venue address: 561 South Pine Road, Everton Park 4053
Bookings: Required. Please phone (07) 3403 8888 to reserve your place.
Cost: Free
item.xCal:description: This workshop is a practical demonstration of how to create a no-dig garden. No-dig gardening is renowned for being low-labour and low-cost, and an extremely simple way to create a healthy, functioning garden bed in no time. Learn step by step how to build the garden, as well as the science behind its success. Presented by Growing Communities. Light refreshments will be served. Bookings essential.
item.x-trumba:customfield: Required. Please phone (07) 3403 8888 to reserve your place.

item.title: Lemons don't just grow on trees with Annette McFarlane
item.description:
Saturday, June 15, 2013, 10:30 – 11am

Celebrate the official opening of the new look Mitchelton Library with Annette McFarlane.

Lemongrass, lemon verbena, lemon balm, native lemon myrtle, thyme and basil are just some of the lemon-flavoured plants that grow well in Brisbane. ABC Radio gardening presenter, Annette McFarlane will demonstrate how to propagate, grow and use lemon-scented plants and other complimentary herbs.   

Venue: Mitchelton Library
Venue address: 37 Heliopolis Pde, Mitchelton 4053
Bookings: Not required.
Cost: Free.
item.xCal:summary: Lemons don't just grow on trees with Annette McFarlane

Lemongrass, lemon verbena, lemon balm, native lemon myrtle, thyme and basil are just some of the lemon-flavoured plants that grow well in Brisbane. ABC Radio gardening presenter, Annette McFarlane will demonstrate how to propagate, grow and use lemon-scented plants and other complimentary herbs.

item.title: Recycled craft activities for children
item.description:
Saturday, June 15, 2013, 8:30pm – 12am

Celebrate the official opening of the new look Mitchelton Library with recycled craft activities for children in the library.

Hosted by Bec Hollis and Ellie Beck, children can weave on a loom and decorate woolen snowflakes using recycled yarn. Children will be encouraged to help decorate the community citrus garden by displaying their creations along the fence of the garden at the front entrance to Mitchelton Library.

Children can join the fun at any stage throughout the morning.  

Venue: Mitchelton Library
Venue address: 37 Heliopolis Pde, Mitchelton 4053
Bookings: Not required.
Cost: Free

item.title: Create your own herb garden
item.description:
Wednesday, June 19, 2013, 10am – 12pm

Herbs are some of the easiest and most productive plants you can grow. Great for beginner gardeners or those with limited space, this workshop provides you with the opportunity to created your own mixed potted herb garden to take home and enjoy. Presented by ABC Radio gardening presenter, Annette McFarlane. Bookings essential.

Venue: Zillmere Library
Venue address: Cnr Jennings St & Zillmere Rd, Zillmere 4034
Cost: Free

item.title: Low cost gardening
item.description:
Saturday, June 22, 2013, 10am – 12pm

Learn how to create a great garden without spending a fortune and help reduce your carbon footprint. Make your own fertiliser and garden sprays. Discover how to get plants, mulch, labour and much more for free. Presented by ABC Radio gardening presenter, Annette McFarlane. Bookings essential.

Venue: Ashgrove Library
Venue address: 87 Amarina Ave, Ashgrove 4060
Bookings: Required. Please phone (07) 3403 8888 to reserve your place.
Cost: Free
item.xCal:description: Learn how to create a great garden without spending a fortune and help reduce your carbon footprint. Make your own fertiliser and garden sprays. Discover how to get plants, mulch, labour and much more for free. Presented by ABC Radio gardening presenter, Annette McFarlane. Bookings essential.
item.x-trumba:customfield: Required. Please phone (07) 3403 8888 to reserve your place.

item.title: Create your own herb garden
item.description:
Saturday, June 29, 2013, 11am – 2pm

Herbs are some of the easiest and most productive plants to grow. This workshop provides you with the opportunity to create your own mixed potted herb garden to take home and enjoy. Presented by ABC radio gardening presenter, Annette McFarlane. Bookings essential.

Venue: New Farm Library
Venue address: 135 Sydney St, New Farm 4005
Bookings: Required. Please phone (07) 3403 8888 to reserve your place.
Cost: Free

item.title: Sensual pleasures of the garden
item.description:
Saturday, June 29, 2013, 11am – 1pm

A garden can be more than something to look at, offering sensory delight from fragrance and soft velvety or spiky foliage. Design your garden with the senses of smell, touch and taste in mind, including how to make a fragrant herb trail to amble through. Find how your planting can enhance pleasure in your garden. Presented by Paul Plant, editor of subTropical Gardening magazine. Bookings essential.

Venue: Fairfield Library
Venue address: Fairfield Gardens Shopping Centre, Fairfield Rd, Fairfield Q 4103
Bookings: Required. Please phone (07) 3403 8888 to reserve your place.
Cost: Free

Design your garden with the senses of smell, touch and taste in mind, including how to make a fragrant herb trail to amble through. Find how your planting can enhance pleasure in your garden. Presented by Paul Plant, editor of subTropical Gardening magazine. Bookings essential.

item.title: Far OUT Forest Festival
item.description:
Wednesday, July 3, 2013, 10am – 2pm

Brisbane City Council invites you to free school holiday fun in the gardens. Join us for:
  • African drumming (Japanese Garden, 10am-1pm)
  • Wearable art (Japanese Garden, 11am-1pm)
  • Insect discovery (Japanese Garden)
  • Traditional Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander games (Lawn near Bonsai House)
  • Bush string making (Lawn near Bonsai House)
  • Worm magic (Bandstand lawn)
  • Bats and batty art (Bandstand lawn)
  • Ab-fab Fibonacci (Bandstand lawn)
  • Fantastic forest (Wedding Lawn 1)
  • Storytime (Chidlren's Trail Lookout near koala, 11am-1pm)
  • Yarn tree show (Bandstand stage, 12-12:45pm)
  • Roving Knitted Nancy (10:30-11:15am)
  • Hildegard on safari (1:15-2pm)

Parking is limited. Catch a free shuttle bus from Bus Stop 23, Toowong Village, Sherwood Road. Buses leave every 15 minutes from Toowong to the Brisbane Botanic Gardens from 9:30am to 2:15 and from the Brisbane Botanic Gardens to Toowong from 9:45 to 2:15.

Cost: Free
Bookings: No bookings required. Call (07) 3403 888 for more information.
Venue: Brisbane Botanic Gardens, Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Mount Coot-tha Road, Mount Coot-tha
